author: Cortex XSOAR

commands.description: Updates an existing user with the data passed in the user-profile argument.
commands.name: iam-update-user

commands.description: Creates a user.
commands.name: iam-create-user

commands.description: Retrieves a User Profile schema which holds all of the user fields within the application. Used for outgoing-mapping through the Get Schema option.
commands.name: get-mapping-fields

commands.description: Disable an active user.
commands.name: iam-disable-user

commands.description: Retrieves a single user resource.
commands.name: iam-get-user

integration.description: Integrate with GitHub services to perform Identity Lifecycle Management operations.
integration.name: GitHub IAM

commands.description: Gets the usage details of GitHub action workflows of private repositories by repository owner.

commands.description: Returns events corresponding to the given issue.
commands.name: Github-list-issue-events

commands.description: Adds up to 10 assignees to an issue/PR. Users already assigned to an issue are not replaced.
commands.name: GitHub-add-assignee

commands.description: Gets a pull request.
commands.name: GitHub-get-pull-request

commands.description: Gets pull requests corresponding to the given branch name.
commands.name: GitHub-list-branch-pull-requests

commands.description: Lists the teams for an organization. Note that this API call is only available to authenticated members of the organization.
commands.name: GitHub-list-teams

commands.description: Create a new branch.
commands.name: GitHub-create-branch

commands.description: Updates the parameters of a specified issue.
commands.name: GitHub-update-issue

commands.description: Gets list of files from the given path in the repository.
commands.name: Github-list-files

commands.description: Triggers a GitHub workflow on a given repository and workflow.
commands.name: GitHub-trigger-workflow

commands.description: Creates an issue in GitHub.
commands.name: GitHub-create-issue

commands.description: Deletes a branch.
commands.name: GitHub-delete-branch

commands.description: Gets inactive pull requests.
commands.name: GitHub-get-stale-prs

commands.description: Lists team members.
commands.name: GitHub-list-team-members

commands.description: Deletes a comment.
commands.name: GitHub-delete-comment

commands.description: Lists all issues that the user has access to view.
commands.name: GitHub-list-all-issues

commands.description: Retrieves a user membership status with a team.
commands.name: GitHub-get-team-membership

commands.description: Returns a merged pull request. If the pull request has been merged, the API returns 'Status: 204 No Content'. If the pull request has not been merged the API returns 'Status: 404 Not Found'.
commands.name: GitHub-is-pr-merged

commands.description: Closes an existing issue.
commands.name: GitHub-close-issue

commands.description: Gets a check run details.
commands.name: Github-get-check-run

commands.description: Lists reviews on a pull request.
commands.name: GitHub-list-pr-reviews

commands.description: Searches for and returns issues that match a given query.
commands.name: GitHub-search-issues

commands.description: Creates a comment for a given issue.
commands.name: GitHub-create-comment

commands.description: Cancels a GitHub workflow.
commands.name: GitHub-cancel-workflow

commands.description: Commits a given file.
commands.name: Github-commit-file

commands.description: Lists all the review comments for a pull request.
commands.name: GitHub-list-pr-review-comments

commands.description: Adds labels to an issue.
commands.name: GitHub-add-label

commands.description: Gets a branch.
commands.name: GitHub-get-branch

commands.description: Update an already existing comment.
commands.name: GitHub-update-comment

commands.description: Lists comments on an issue.
commands.name: GitHub-list-issue-comments

commands.description: Gets releases data from a given repository and organization.
commands.name: GitHub-releases-list

commands.description: Lists all issues that the user has access to view.
commands.name: GitHub-list-all-projects

commands.description: Gets the data of the a given path.
commands.name: GitHub-get-path-data

commands.description: Updates a pull request in a repository.
commands.name: GitHub-update-pull-request

commands.description: Create a release.
commands.name: GitHub-create-release

commands.description: Lists the pull request files.
commands.name: GitHub-list-pr-files

commands.description: Gets the content of a file from GitHub.
commands.name: GitHub-get-file-content

commands.description: Gets a commit.
commands.name: GitHub-get-commit

commands.description: Requests reviews from GitHub users for a given pull request.
commands.name: GitHub-request-review

commands.description: Adds an Issue as a card in column of a spesific project.
commands.name: GitHub-add-issue-to-project-board

commands.description: Returns a list of GitHub workflows on a given repository.
commands.name: GitHub-list-workflows

commands.description: Returns the total number of downloads for all releases for the specified repository.
commands.name: GitHub-get-download-count

commands.description: Searches for code in repositories that match a given query.
commands.name: GitHub-search-code

commands.description: Creates a new pull request.
commands.name: GitHub-create-pull-request

description: Manage GitHub issues and pull requests directly from Cortex XSOAR
name: GitHub
readme:
Use the GitHub integration to manage GitHub issues and pull requests directly from Cortex XSOAR.

## What does this pack do
Among other things, this integration enables you to:
- Create, close, or update a GitHub issue.
- Get a list of all GitHub issues you have access to.
- Create a branch in GitHub.
- Get a list of a GitHub issue's comments.
- Create or update a GitHub pull request.
- Search for a GitHub pull request.
- Get a list of files for a GitHub pull request.
- Get a list of inactive GitHub pull requests.
- Get the contents of a file in GitHub.
- Create a release.
